====================================================
MATH RACING TUTOR - AUDIO ASSET REQUIREMENTS
====================================================

Place audio files in this folder (dist/assets/audio/).
The game will automatically use them if found, otherwise
it will fall back to synthesized sounds.

Supported formats: MP3, OGG, WAV (MP3 preferred for compatibility)

====================================================
SOUND EFFECTS (Short audio clips)
====================================================

1. click.mp3
   - Description: Button click / UI interaction sound
   - Length: 0.1 - 0.2 seconds
   - Style: Short blip, satisfying click, arcade button press
   - Example: "blip", "pop", "tap"

2. correct.mp3
   - Description: Correct answer celebration
   - Length: 0.3 - 0.5 seconds
   - Style: Ascending tones, cheerful, rewarding
   - Example: "ding ding ding!", coin collect sound, level up

3. wrong.mp3
   - Description: Wrong answer / time's up
   - Length: 0.2 - 0.4 seconds
   - Style: Descending tones, buzzer, not too harsh (kid-friendly)
   - Example: Soft buzzer, "bonk", error beep

4. boost.mp3
   - Description: Turbo boost activation
   - Length: 0.5 - 1.0 seconds
   - Style: Whoosh, acceleration, power-up feel
   - Example: Rocket ignition, speed boost, nitro activation

5. countdown.mp3
   - Description: Race countdown beep (3, 2, 1)
   - Length: 0.2 - 0.3 seconds
   - Style: Simple beep, countdown tone
   - Example: "beep" for each count

6. countdown_go.mp3
   - Description: Race start "GO!" sound
   - Length: 0.3 - 0.5 seconds
   - Style: Higher pitch than countdown, exciting, starting horn
   - Example: Air horn, race start signal, "GO!" announcement

7. lap.mp3
   - Description: Lap completion / checkpoint
   - Length: 0.3 - 0.6 seconds
   - Style: Victory chord, checkpoint ding, progress sound
   - Example: Checkpoint chime, lap bell, flag wave

8. win.mp3
   - Description: Race victory fanfare
   - Length: 1.0 - 2.0 seconds
   - Style: Triumphant, celebratory, kids cheering optional
   - Example: Victory fanfare, trophy sound, confetti pop

9. lose.mp3
   - Description: Race loss sound
   - Length: 0.5 - 1.0 seconds
   - Style: Sad trombone, deflating, but not discouraging
   - Example: "wah wah wah", soft failure sound

====================================================
BACKGROUND MUSIC (Looping tracks)
====================================================

10. music_menu.mp3
    - Description: Menu / pre-race background music
    - Length: 30-60 seconds (will loop)
    - Style: Upbeat, anticipatory, fun, not too intense
    - BPM: 100-120
    - Example: Arcade lobby music, racing game menu theme

11. music_race.mp3
    - Description: In-race background music
    - Length: 60-120 seconds (will loop)
    - Style: Fast-paced, exciting, driving rhythm, energetic
    - BPM: 130-160
    - Example: Racing game action music, chase scene music

12. music_victory.mp3
    - Description: Victory screen music
    - Length: 15-30 seconds (can loop or fade)
    - Style: Celebratory, triumphant, uplifting
    - Example: Podium music, winner theme

====================================================
ENGINE SOUNDS (Optional, for immersion)
====================================================

13. engine_idle.mp3
    - Description: Car engine idle loop
    - Length: 2-5 seconds (seamless loop)
    - Style: Low rumble, racing car idle
    - Note: Will be pitch-shifted based on speed

14. engine_rev.mp3
    - Description: Engine acceleration
    - Length: 1-2 seconds
    - Style: Engine revving up
    - Note: Played during boost

====================================================
NOTES FOR AUDIO CREATION
====================================================

- All sounds should be KID-FRIENDLY and not scary/harsh
- Keep file sizes small for fast loading (< 500KB each for SFX)
- Music can be larger but aim for < 2MB each
- Ensure proper licensing for any sourced audio
- Test on mobile devices for volume balance
- MP3 at 128kbps is sufficient for sound effects
- MP3 at 192kbps recommended for music
